resources.string: ueTraveler
Welcome to the network
During this adventure you will be able to experience three more procedures. Attach, Handover and Carrier Aggregation.
Attach procedure

Good job with unlocking needed cells! Now you can attach to it. To do that you need to choose suitable cell and perform an attach. Which one is suitable? The one you will be CAPABLE to handle as a UE.
Communication with network

You will be communicating with network by scanning NFC tags in different places. To start scanning press "Start scanning".The button will change to red color, indicating that scanning is ongoing.\n Scanning will stop automatically after tag will be scanned.\nColor will change to blue, indicating that scanning is stopped.
Capabilities
First step - you need to know what is your capabilities. To know that scan first tag on YOUR desktop. Good luck with further adventures and procedures!

Frequencies:
 Technology:GSM / HSPA / LTE / 5G
 
 2G Bands:
 GSM - 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900 - SIM 1 and SIM 2
 
 3G Bands:
 HSDPA - 850 / 900 / 1900 / 2100
 
 4G Bands:
 LTE Band - 1(2100), 3(1800), 5(850), 7(2600), 8(900),34(2000), 38(2600), 39(1900), 40(2300), 41(2500)
 
 5G Bands:
 5G Band - 41(2500MHz, arfcn 499200-537996), 78(3500MHz, arfcn 620000-653332)
 
 Network Speed
 HSPA 42.2/5.76 Mbps, LTE-A, 5G (2+ Gbps DL)
NRCellDU=DRVI52A
MSG 1 sent not in correct order.\n Remember that MSG1 (Random access Preamble) is a first\n UE message send to initiate attach procedure.
MSG 3 sent not in correct order.\n Remember that MSG3 (RRCSetupRequest) is a message\n UE send after receiving MSG2(Random access response)
RRCSetupComplete message sent not in correct order.\n RRCSetupComplete message is a UE response\n for PUSCH:RRCSetup received from GNB
SecurityModeComplete sent not in correct order.\n SecurityModeComplete is a response for NR RRC:SecurityModeCommand received from GNB

RDN = GNBDUFunction=1,NRSectorCarrier=DRVI52A
Arfcn = 518598
CellState = BARRED
nRPCI=11
Start attach?
Attach failed! Try another Cell

NRCellDU=DRVI52A
Unfortunately attach has not started.
Cell BARRED
NRCellDU=DRVI52D

RDN = GNBDUFunction=1,NRSectorCarrier=DRVI52D
Arfcn = 518598
CellState = BARRED
nRPCI=13
Start attach?
Attach failed! Try another Cell

NRCellDU=DRVI52D
Unfortunately attach has not started.
Cell BARRED
NRCellDU=DRVI52C

RDN = GNBDUFunction=1,NRSectorCarrier=DRVI52C
Arfcn = 403500
CellState = NOT_BARRED
nRPCI=14
Start attach?
Attach failed! Try another Cell

NRCellDU=DRVI52C
Unfortunately attach has not started.
UE is not cabable of Arfcn = 403500
NRCellDU=DRVI52B

RDN = GNBDUFunction=1,NRSectorCarrier=DRVI52B
Arfcn = 518598
CellState = NOT_BARRED
nRPCI=12
Start attach?

PRACH: MSG1 
 ---------------------------------------->
 Successfully sent
 
 PDSCH: MSG2
 <----------------------------------------
 Received from GNB
 
 BB part of GNB is waiting for the next message
 ????-------------------------------------->

PUSCH:MSG 3 (RRCSetupRequest) 
 ---------------------------------------->
 Successfully sent
 
 PUSCH: RRCSetup
 <----------------------------------------
 Received from GNB
 
 Respond to the GNB using PUSCH
 ????-------------------------------------->

PUSCH:RRCSetupComplete 
 ---------------------------------------->
 Successfully sent
 
 NR RRC: SecurityModeCommand
 <----------------------------------------
 Received from GNB
 
 Respond to the GNB using NR RRC 
 ????-------------------------------------->

NR RRC:SecurityModeComplete
 ---------------------------------------->
 successfully sent
 
 Attach procedure complete. Congratulations!
 Next password latter is "C"(1,6,27)
 But it is not the end of your travel. Your user has just started moving through the world. To keep connection with the network you need to do a handover!
 To find Neighbor cell nTAG you need to access cellMap
 You can access cellMap from database
 "SocketInTheMiddleOfTheTable.db".
 Use this map to locate the next neighboring cell on the correct office floor.
Well done! You have connected again.\n Go ahead and try to find next cell. Remember to check signal quality carefully.\n You have received additional letter for the password "O"(2,21,29)
Well done! You have connected again.\n Proceed with Carrier aggregation procedure.\n
Neighbor Cell Detected

RSRP = -67 dBm
 RSRQ = -8 dB
 nRPCI = 21
 Do you want to perform a Handover to this cell?
Handover Successful!\n
nRPCI\n21

Letter for the password "N"(3,4,22).
 But something is happening! It looks like your user has moved to a comfortable place and started watching YouTube with 2160p-4k quality – high data demand detected!
 
 Quickly find the locker number 3.039, open it and perform the Carrier Aggregation procedure to boost capacity and ensure smooth streaming.

RSRP = -67 dBm
 RSRQ = -8 dB
 nRPCI = 21
 Do you want to perform a Handover to this cell?
Handover Failed – PCI Conflict Detected!\n

\n Info: \n A PCI conflict in 5G NR happens when nearby cells share the same ID, causing interference during cell detection and handover. Connection was lost. Please re-attach to the network and try again. To proceed, scan the Re-Attach tag located on the door of the starting room.
Handover failed!

RSRP = -80 dBm
 RSRQ = -9 dB
 nRPCI = 15
 Do you want to perform a Handover to this cell?
Target cell rejected due to insufficient signal quality. Look for another cell with better signal.

RSRP = -85 dBm
 RSRQ = -6 dB
 nRPCI = 31
 Do you want to perform a Handover to this cell?
Target cell rejected due to insufficient signal quality. Look for another cell with better signal.
Congratulations!
You have completed all necessary procedures. Throughput is on maximum level. User is watching video with maximum quality and stable connection. Last letter for the password is "E" (5,8,11,16,19,26)
